column2: {u'Fn::Join': [u'\n', [u'#! /bin/bash', u'LISTEN_ADDRESS=$(curl -s http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/local-ipv4)', u'nohup vault server -dev-listen-address=${LISTEN_ADDRESS}:8200 -dev > /etc/vault/vault-server-log.out 2>&1 &', u'echo done', u'exit 0']]}

{u'Fn::Base64': {u'Fn::Join': [u'', [u'#!/bin/bash -x
', u'# Install the files and packages from the metadata
', u'/opt/aws/bin/cfn-init -v ', u'         --stack ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::StackName'}, u'         --resource VaultInstances ', u'         --region ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::Region'}, u'
', u'# Signal the status from cfn-init
', u'/opt/aws/bin/cfn-signal -e $? ', u'         --stack ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::StackName'}, u'         --resource EC2VaultAutoScalingGroup ', u'         --region ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::Region'}, u'
']]}}
URL for VAULT_ADDRESS which should be exported locally for CLI
By default we will create a new Subnet ID or select an existing subnet ID from VPC selected above.
Maximum number of instances that can be launched in your ECS cluster.
By default we will create a new VPC or Select an existing VPC ID.
Name of an existing EC2 key pair to enable SSH access to the ECS instances.
Number of instances to launch in your ECS cluster.
